body_html:
Ok, I guess - despite being ugly - the path is actually valid on Windows. Then the problem seems to be caused by the implementation of RecursivelyCreateDir. Why not using the good old os.makedirs command?

Replacing file_io.recursive_create_dir(self._export_dir) in line 92 with os.makedirs(compat.as_str(self._export_dir), exist_ok=True). Fixed the problem on my side. Notice that the exists=True flag does not yet exist in Python 2.7.
body_text:
Ok, I guess - despite being ugly - the path is actually valid on Windows. Then the problem seems to be caused by the implementation of RecursivelyCreateDir. Why not using the good old os.makedirs command?
Replacing file_io.recursive_create_dir(self._export_dir) in line 92 with os.makedirs(compat.as_str(self._export_dir), exist_ok=True). Fixed the problem on my side. Notice that the exists=True flag does not yet exist in Python 2.7.
body:
Ok, I guess - despite being ugly - the path is actually valid on Windows. Then the problem seems to be caused by the implementation of `RecursivelyCreateDir`. Why not using the good old [`os.makedirs`](https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/os.html#os.makedirs) command? 

Replacing `file_io.recursive_create_dir(self._export_dir)` in [line 92](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/9d2d40079c273e8de8644136b452715c0146b907/tensorflow/python/saved_model/builder_impl.py#L92) with `os.makedirs(compat.as_str(self._export_dir), exist_ok=True)`. Fixed the problem on my side. Notice that the `exists=True` flag does not yet exist in Python 2.7.
